title: No more excuses: NASA in line to get funding needed for Artemis plan
summary: "A lot of people come to work every day that are working to get to 2025."

title: Declaración del administrador de la NASA sobre la solicitud de presupuesto del presidente para el año fiscal 2023
summary: El presupuesto del presidente para el año fiscal 2023 permitiría a la NASA mantener el liderazgo en innovación global de Estados Unidos y mantener a la NASA a la vanguardia de la exploración y el descubrimiento al regresar a la Luna con el programa Artemis, entre otros esfuerzos.

title: NASA Administrator Statement on President’s FY 2023 Budget Request
summary: The President’s fiscal year 2023 budget would allow NASA to sustain America’s global innovation leadership and keep NASA at the forefront of exploration and discovery by returning to the Moon with the Artemis program, among other efforts.

title: Biden’s 2023 defense budget adds billions for U.S. Space Force
summary: President Biden’s $773 billion budget request for the Defense Department for fiscal year 2023 includes $24.5 billion for the U.S. Space Force

title: SES orders software-defined replacement satellite from Thales
summary: SES said March 28 that it ordered a software-defined geostationary satellite from Thales Alenia Space to extend content and connectivity services across Europe, Africa and Asia.

title: “Missile Row” pads at Cape Canaveral returning to action
summary: Cape Canaveral has been at the heart of America’s space program since the very beginning. A hub for rocketry research and development in its early days, the Cape served as a test center not just for spaceflight and research but also for the US missile development programs. With so many projects, the landscape was littered with launch complexes, and along the eastern coastline, the iconic “missile row” of Atlas and Titan launch complexes dominated the skyline.

title: White House requests $26 billion for NASA for 2023
summary: The Biden administration’s fiscal year 2023 budget proposal seeks nearly $26 billion for NASA, with increases for exploration, Earth science and space technology.

title: NASA to Provide Updates, Coverage for Final Test Ahead of Moon Mission
summary: NASA will hold a media teleconference at 1 p.m. EDT Tuesday, March 29, to discuss the upcoming final major test with the agency’s Mega Moon rocket and spacecraft at the launch pad ahead of the uncrewed Artemis I lunar mission.

title: SpaceX’s Starbase environmental review suffers third delay
summary: The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) has announced that the completion of a crucial ‘environmental assessment’ SpaceX needs to begin orbital-class Starship launch...

title: White House requests $26 billion for NASA in ’23, adds funds for second moon lander
summary: The White House’s fiscal year 2023 budget request for NASA totals $26 billion, including $7.5 billion for the agency’s Artemis moon program, a boost over this year’s budget to help pay for development of a second human-rated lander to ferry astronauts to the lunar surface.
